summary: This document is an email exchange from December 31, 2019, between a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and a law enforcement or support official. The victim expresses gratitude for assistance with therapy options, offers to be interviewed, and references coordination with prosecutors. The official apologizes for a delayed response, confirms the need to interview the victim, and states they will contact prosecutors.

events.title: Email Exchange Regarding Victim Support
events.description: A victim and an official exchange emails discussing therapy options and the need for the victim to be interviewed by prosecutors.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein is seeking therapy options and is willing to be interviewed by prosecutors as of late December 2019.
A law enforcement or support official is coordinating with prosecutors to arrange an interview with the victim.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative activity and victim support efforts related to the Epstein case at the end of 2019.
